comment.body: Seems okay. Now that error checking is done within the remoteconfig pkg I think some of those appsec wrappers can be replaced by direct calls to the remoteconfig API. I don't want to bother you with this so I'm okay with keeping it this way, I'll follow-up with an appsec focused PR 👍

pull_request.title: remoteconfig: make rc client a singleton
pull_request.body:
<!--
* New contributors are highly encouraged to read our
  [CONTRIBUTING](/CONTRIBUTING.md) documentation.
* Commit and PR titles should be prefixed with the general area of the pull request's change.

-->
### What does this PR do?

AIT-8578
Make the remote config client a singleton. Tracing and profiling will then be able to use it in addition to ASM.

<!--
* A brief description of the change being made with this pull request.
* If the description here cannot be expressed in a succinct form, consider
  opening multiple pull requests instead of a single one.
-->

### Motivation

It's a requirement to have a single shared instance of the remote config client per tracer.

issue.title: .gitlab/macrobenchmarks.yml: fix CI configuration, substitute `master` for `main` on execution policy
issue.body:
<!--
* New contributors are highly encouraged to read our
  [CONTRIBUTING](/CONTRIBUTING.md) documentation.
* Commit and PR titles should be prefixed with the general area of the pull request's change.

-->
### What does this PR do?
This PR fixes the macrobenchmark CI configuration, enabling macrobenchmarks to be run on commits merged to the `main` branch, instead of the `master` branch, as was mistakenly set before.

Related PR: https://github.com/DataDog/dd-trace-go/pull/2285

pull_request.title: source-code-integration: Remove credentials from git repository url.
pull_request.body:
If https credentials are mistakenly injected in the repository URL env var or DD tags, the function responsible for extracting the url will remove the credentials from the traces & profiles.

<!--
* New contributors are highly encouraged to read our
  [CONTRIBUTING](/CONTRIBUTING.md) documentation.
* Commit and PR titles should be prefixed with the general area of the pull request's change.

-->
### What does this PR do?

This PR removes the credentials that could be present in a repository URL passed through DD_TAGS or DD_GIT_REPOSITORY_URL.

### Motivation

We want users to be able to configure DD_GIT_REPOSITORY_URL by running:
```
export DD_GIT_REPOSITORY_URL="$(git config --get remote.origin.url)"
```
In some cases, this command can inject a user auth information in the env var. We want to remove the credentials before annotating the telemetry with this information.

We have a system test available [here](https://github.com/DataDog/system-tests/blob/7a220704f2ab3180e617cd7029cf655a6907db6c/tests/parametric/test_tracer.py#L122) to verify this behavior. 
I have manually checked that this system test pass with these changes.

### Reviewer's Checklist
<!--
* Authors can use this list as a reference to ensure that there are no problems
  during the review but the signing off is to be done by the reviewer(s).
-->

- [ ] Changed code has unit tests for its functionality at or near 100% coverage.
- [ ] There is a benchmark for any new code, or changes to existing code.
- [ ] If this interacts with the agent in a new way, a system test has been added.

For Datadog employees:

- [ ] If this PR touches code that handles credentials of any kind, such as Datadog API keys, I've requested a review from `@DataDog/security-design-and-guidance`.
- [ ] This PR doesn't touch any of that.

Unsure? Have a question? Request a review!

issue.title: general: replace gopkg.in/DataDog/dd-trace-go.v1 with github.com/DataDog/dd-trace-go/v2
issue.body:
### What does this PR do?

This PR changes the canonical import URL, setting it as `github.com/DataDog/dd-trace-go-v2`.

This is the first step towards the new v2 major version.

### Motivation

`gopkg.in` isn't needed anymore, and it's not well maintained.

### Reviewer's Checklist

- [ ] Changed code has unit tests for its functionality at or near 100% coverage.

- [x] This PR doesn't touch any of that.

Unsure? Have a question? Request a review!

pull_request.title: source-code-integration: Remove credentials from git repository url.
pull_request.body:
If https credentials are mistakenly injected in the repository URL env var or DD tags, the function responsible for extracting the url will remove the credentials from the traces & profiles.

<!--
* New contributors are highly encouraged to read our
  [CONTRIBUTING](/CONTRIBUTING.md) documentation.
* Commit and PR titles should be prefixed with the general area of the pull request's change.

-->
### What does this PR do?

This PR removes the credentials that could be present in a repository URL passed through DD_TAGS or DD_GIT_REPOSITORY_URL.

### Motivation

We want users to be able to configure DD_GIT_REPOSITORY_URL by running:
```
export DD_GIT_REPOSITORY_URL="$(git config --get remote.origin.url)"
```
In some cases, this command can inject a user auth information in the env var. We want to remove the credentials before annotating the telemetry with this information.

We have a system test available [here](https://github.com/DataDog/system-tests/blob/7a220704f2ab3180e617cd7029cf655a6907db6c/tests/parametric/test_tracer.py#L122) to verify this behavior. 
I have manually checked that this system test pass with these changes.

### Reviewer's Checklist
<!--
* Authors can use this list as a reference to ensure that there are no problems
  during the review but the signing off is to be done by the reviewer(s).
-->

- [ ] Changed code has unit tests for its functionality at or near 100% coverage.
- [ ] There is a benchmark for any new code, or changes to existing code.
- [ ] If this interacts with the agent in a new way, a system test has been added.

For Datadog employees:

- [ ] If this PR touches code that handles credentials of any kind, such as Datadog API keys, I've requested a review from `@DataDog/security-design-and-guidance`.
- [ ] This PR doesn't touch any of that.

Unsure? Have a question? Request a review!

pull_request.title: Export SamplingPriority method on spanContext [SVLS-3934]
pull_request.body:
<!--
* New contributors are highly encouraged to read our
  [CONTRIBUTING](/CONTRIBUTING.md) documentation.
* Commit and PR titles should be prefixed with the general area of the pull request's change.

-->
### What does this PR do?

Exports the `SamplingPriority` method on the `spanContext` type.

<!--
* A brief description of the change being made with this pull request.
* If the description here cannot be expressed in a succinct form, consider
  opening multiple pull requests instead of a single one.
-->

### Motivation

We on the serverless team are working to update the Lambda Extension from doing manual trace context extraction to instead deferring to dd-trace-go for all extraction. This will allow us to be able to support W3C trace context headers.

The problem is that we also need to have access to the sampling priority. We must add this value to the trace chunk before it's processed by the trace agent.

Currently, dd-trace-go offers no way for us to get access to the sampling priority.

<!--
* What inspired you to submit this pull request?
* Link any related GitHub issues or PRs here.
* If this resolves a GitHub issue, include "Fixes #XXXX" to link the issue and auto-close it on merge.
-->

### Discussion

I am very much open to discussion for how best to get the sampling priority from the `SpanContext`. I have chosen to simply export the `SamplingPriority` method because it's the lightest touch creating a small diff. Furthermore, the exported method will not show up in godocs and therefore not be immediately visible to users. One would have to read the code and specifically cast the `SpanContext` to a new interface to get access to it.

Here's how I'm proposing to use the method:

```go
func getSamplingPriority(sc ddtrace.SpanContext) (priority sampler.SamplingPriority) {
	priority = defaultPriority
	if pc, ok := sc.(interface{ SamplingPriority() (int, bool) }); ok && pc != nil {
		if p, ok := pc.SamplingPriority(); ok {
			priority = sampler.SamplingPriority(p)
		}
	}
	return
}
```

### Reviewer's Checklist
<!--
* Authors can use this list as a reference to ensure that there are no problems
  during the review but the signing off is to be done by the reviewer(s).
-->

- [ ] Changed code has unit tests for its functionality at or near 100% coverage.
- [ ] There is a benchmark for any new code, or changes to existing code.
- [ ] If this interacts with the agent in a new way, a system test has been added.

For Datadog employees:

- [ ] If this PR touches code that handles credentials of any kind, such as Datadog API keys, I've requested a review from `@DataDog/security-design-and-guidance`.
- [ ] This PR doesn't touch any of that.

Unsure? Have a question? Request a review!

payload.description: Datadog Go Library including APM tracing, profiling, and security monitoring.

comment.body:
I think the client creation + `client.startOnce()` should be a thread safe block. Otherwise we could end up with a global client with a startOnce that actually hasn't been called, even though a goroutine is running and using it.

Here is what I'm trying to describe (g1 and g2 beeing 2 separate goroutines both calling `Start()`):

g1: newClient() -------  startOnceStart -------------- startOnceEnd
g2: -------------------------------------newClient() -------------

I think a simple solution in this case would be to move the global client assignment at the end of the startOnce function. Am I making sense?

pull_request.title: remoteconfig: make rc client a singleton
pull_request.body:
<!--
* New contributors are highly encouraged to read our
  [CONTRIBUTING](/CONTRIBUTING.md) documentation.
* Commit and PR titles should be prefixed with the general area of the pull request's change.

-->
### What does this PR do?

AIT-8578
Make the remote config client a singleton. Tracing and profiling will then be able to use it in addition to ASM.

<!--
* A brief description of the change being made with this pull request.
* If the description here cannot be expressed in a succinct form, consider
  opening multiple pull requests instead of a single one.

It's a requirement to have a single shared instance of the remote config client per tracer.
